spot.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a particular place or area, especially a pleasant place where you spend time
spot.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: a nice quiet spot on the beach
I chose a spot well away from the road.
the exact spot where the king was executed
a small cottage in an idyllic spot
Why do they want to build a house on this particular spot?
an ideal spot for a picnic
spot.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: a usually round area on a surface that is a different colour or is rougher, smoother etc than the rest
spot.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: a white cat with brown spots
Two spots of colour appeared in Jill’s cheeks.
spot.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a small mark on something, especially one that is made by a liquid
spot.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: There was a big damp spot on the wall.
spot.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: a small round red area on someone’s skin that shows that they are ill
spot.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: He had a high fever and was covered in spots.
spot.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: a small raised red mark on someone’s skin, especially on their face
spot.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Becka was very self-conscious about her spots.
spot.translation[0].definitions[5].defin: a short period of time when someone can speak or perform on radio or television
spot.translation[0].definitions[5].examp: He was given a 30-second spot just after the news.
a guest spot on ‘The Tonight Show’
spot.translation[0].definitions[6].defin: a position in a list of things or in a competition
spot.translation[0].definitions[6].examp: The budget has a regular spot on the agenda.
Manchester United are still in the top spot after today’s win.
spot.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to notice someone or something, especially when they are difficult to see or recognize
spot.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I spotted a police car behind us.
It can be hard for even a trained doctor to spot the symptoms of lung cancer.
Drug addicts are fairly easy to spot.
Meg spotted someone coming out of the building.
One of the station staff spotted that I was in difficulty, and came to help.
spot.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: to give the other player in a game an advantage
spot.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: He spotted me six points and he still won.
spot.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: for buying or paying immediately, not at some future time
spot.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: They won’t take credit; they want spot cash.
He quoted us a spot price for the goods.
spot.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: involving delivery now, rather than in the future
spot.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The settlement period for spot transactions is two business days.
a spot cash payment  (=for goods that are delivered immediately)
